page.title: 11More Interesting Names
page.content: Quite near to Galabank are two short streets of old houses called { {Albert Place }and {Alexandra Place,} which were named after members of the Royal family of the time. These names give a good clue as to when these houses were built. Before and after the Second World War, the Annan Town Council, which no longer exists, built many streets full of council houses. Some of these streets are in our area and we found out that quite a lot of them were named after people who were on the council at the time. Some examples are {Graham Avenue, Tweedie Terrace, {Thorburn Crescent, Wallace Crescent, {Dykes Avenue, Matheson Terrace}and {MacNeish Drive.}The same thing happened in another part of the town, so many of the councillors had streets named after them.
